title: Pentagon eases cloak of secrecy around space warfare training
summary: Col. Christopher Fernengel, of the Space Force's Space Operations Command: ‘They're directing changes to declassify where it makes sense’

title: SpaceX launches two Starlink missions just over 24 hours apart
summary: Last week SpaceX launched two Starlink missions from Florida just over 24 hours apart, sending a total of 46 satellites to orbit....

title: No more jammer sales: it’s time for global enforcement
summary: It is time for the United States to coordinate international efforts to halt the marketing and sale of devices that interfere with GNSS systems.

title: Putting cremains on the moon is disrespectful – and bad policy
summary: The issue of sending cremains to a celestial body that, because of our relationship with it, essentially belongs to all of us is not a private matter to be settled solely by companies offering such services and firms flying landers to the moon.

title: NASA confirms Dragonfly mission despite doubled costs
summary: NASA has approved for development a mission to Saturn’s moon Titan despite a cost that has doubled since the agency selected the mission nearly five years ago.

title: China launches second Yaogan-42 reconnaissance satellite
summary: China launched its second Yaogan-42 reconnaissance satellite over the weekend, weeks after sending the first such satellite into a similar orbit.

title: Jamming, Spoofing, Hacking: Today’s Most Pervasive Counterspace Threats
summary: While speculation about Russian nuclear weapons in space and actual destructive antisatellite tests grab the headlines, experts from two organizations that track “counterspace” activities are pointing out more immediate threats […]

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy April 21-27, 2024

title: BlueHalo wins $24 million Air Force contract for research and analysis of satellite vulnerabilities
summary: AFRL's Satellite Assessment Center at Kirtland Air Force Base, New Mexico, evaluates the effects of laser radiation on space vehicles

title: Slovenia signs Artemis Accords
summary: Slovenia signed the Artemis Accords outlining best practices for sustainable space exploration April 19, the third European country to do so in five days.
